aroma.notes: Faint but fresh, not as much vanilla warmth.

acidity.notes: Weak and watery but pointedly, darkly acidic. Lime juice lingers in mouth on swallow. Citrus/alkaline acidity increases just slightly as coffee cools.

finish.notes: Finish disappears. Mouth is relatively neutral â€” the slightest tinge of sandpapery dryness on mouth and particularly teeth.

flavor: Very different. Surprisingly weak. Fruit note is more of a cold, chilly kind. This would encourage me to grind finer.
notes: 8 second bloom with 70g water, high initial pour, 200g by 1:00, finish at 1:25 (low but fast), S+T around 1:45. For bloom pour, I kept water in the well and it did not drain out nearly as fast (definitely preferred this). Drawdown did not slow down a drip like last time.
actionItem: Change grind to 23 using the same technique.
